properties.Name: Dividend
properties.Description:
The distribution of earnings to shareholders and paid in the form of money, stock, scrip or company products or property (rarely).

A dividend is a portion of a company's profit paid to common and preferred shareholders.

The amount is decided by the board of directors and is paid on the Dividend Period.

Columns.Name: StockId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Financial Product.

Columns.Name: DividendTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Dividend Type.

Columns.Name: DividendDeclarationDate
Columns.Description: The date upon which a company announces the amount and date of its next dividend payment.

Columns.Name: DateOfRecord
Columns.Description:
The date by which the shareholder must officially own shares to be entitled to the dividend.

The period of time between the Declaration Date and the Data of Record is known as the Distribution Period.

Date by which a shareholder must officially own shares in order to be entitled to a dividend. For example, a firm might declare a dividend on Nov 1, payable Dec 1 to holders of record Nov 15.
Once a trade is executed an investor becomes the "owner of record" on settlement, which currently takes 5 business days for securities, and one business day for mutual funds. Stocks
trade ex-dividend the fourth day before the record date, since the seller will still be the owner of
record and is thus entitled to the dividend.

Columns.Name: ExDividendDate
Columns.Description:
The date on which a stock goes ex-dividend.

Shares listed on the NYSE go ex-dividend four business days before the record date.

The first day of trading when the seller, rather than the buyer, of a stock will be entitled to the most recently announced dividend payment. This date set by the NYSE (and generally followed on other US exchanges) is currently two business days before the record date. A stock that has gone ex-dividend is marked with an X in newspaper listings on that date.

Columns.Name: DividendDistributionDate
Columns.Description: The date that the dividend is actually distributed to eligible parties.

Columns.Name: DividendAmountPerShare
Columns.Description: The amount of dividend per share of stock owned as of the record date.

Columns.Name: DividendNonTaxableAmountPerShare
Columns.Description: The amount per share that is non-taxable.

Columns.Name: DividendCapitalGainsAmountPerShare
Columns.Description: The amount of dividend per share that attributable to capital gains.

Columns.Name: DividendPeriodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Dividend Period.

Properties.Description:
The distribution of earnings to shareholders and paid in the form of money, stock, scrip or company products or property (rarely).

A dividend is a portion of a company's profit paid to common and preferred shareholders.

The amount is decided by the board of directors and is paid on the Dividend Period.
